meanings.sent1: She waxed the table to make it shine.
meanings.sent2: I always wax my car to protect the paint.
meanings.sent3: The floor was so slippery after she waxed it that we had a fun sliding contest.
meanings.sent4: His words waxed poetic as he described the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The candle waxed slowly, illuminating the room with a warm glow.

meanings.definition: To increase in size, numbers, strength, or intensity
meanings.sent1: The moon waxed in the night sky, becoming full and bright.
meanings.sent2: Her excitement waxed as the concert drew nearer.
meanings.sent3: His appetite waxed to monstrous proportions after the long hike.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room waxed, making everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The cheers from the crowd waxed louder and louder as the team scored the winning goal.
